title: SOCIAL / COMMODITY / COMMERCE / MARKET see COMMUNITY

GOD.content: commerce is reciprocal and finite exchange of wages, merchandise, reward; Christ’s economy of sacrifice as dissymmetry, but still payment, wages, merces
GOD.linkedContent: commerce is reciprocal and finite exchange of wages, merchandise, reward; Christ’s economy of sacrifice as dissymmetry, but still payment, wages, merces

GOD.content: secret market of secrecy, “Christianity’s stroke of genius,” says Nietzsche, merchandise, give credit to the infinite [denounce all calculation & still yield surplus-value]
GOD.linkedContent: secret market of secrecy, “Christianity’s stroke of genius,” says Nietzsche, merchandise, give credit to the infinite [denounce all calculation & still yield surplus-value]

SPOM.content: inter-ethnic wars driven by “a primitive conceptual phantasm of community”
SPOM.linkedContent: inter-ethnic wars driven by “a primitive conceptual phantasm of community”

SPOM.content: the commodity is blurred (embrouillé), tangled (embarrassant), aporetic, paralyzing, perhaps undecidable (ein sebr vertracktes Ding)
SPOM.linkedContent: the commodity is blurred (embrouillé), tangled (embarrassant), aporetic, paralyzing, perhaps undecidable (ein sebr vertracktes Ding)

SPOM.content: specter is social, otherwise no desire, no love, no peace, no socius, no war
SPOM.linkedContent: specter is social, otherwise no desire, no love, no peace, no socius, no war

SPOM.content: there is always more than one commodity, more than one spirit, number belongs to the movement of the commodity
SPOM.linkedContent: there is always more than one commodity, more than one spirit, number belongs to the movement of the commodity

SPOM.content: socius binds men through the interest of time, apprehension of time related to commodity-specters, time comes from difference
SPOM.linkedContent: socius binds men through the interest of time, apprehension of time related to commodity-specters, time comes from difference

SPOM.content: secret of commodity form is substitution (quid pro quo), but one w/ ruse, perverse intervention of souffleur, parole soufflée > abnormal play of mirrors [men no longer recognize in the substitution made by commodity the social character of their own labor], commodity turns men into specters, vampires > can’t see their reflection, “but who is not so deprived?” Derrida adds
SPOM.linkedContent: secret of commodity form is substitution (quid pro quo), but one w/ ruse, perverse intervention of souffleur, parole soufflée > abnormal play of mirrors [men no longer recognize in the substitution made by commodity the social character of their own labor], commodity turns men into specters, vampires > can’t see their reflection, “but who is not so deprived?” Derrida adds

SPOM.content: phantasmagoria of a commerce btwn market things makes socius seem natural, labor objectified in things, while denaturalizing thing becomes commodity
SPOM.linkedContent: phantasmagoria of a commerce btwn market things makes socius seem natural, labor objectified in things, while denaturalizing thing becomes commodity

SPOM.content: Marx doesn’t just show the phantomalization of the commodity-form but the phantomalization of the social bond
SPOM.linkedContent: Marx doesn’t just show the phantomalization of the commodity-form but the phantomalization of the social bond

SPOM.content: “mystical character” of commodity is inscribed before being inscribed, traced before being written letter for letter, everything begins before it begins > but Marx wants to know the instant the ghost comes on stage—this is a manner of exorcism
SPOM.linkedContent: “mystical character” of commodity is inscribed before being inscribed, traced before being written letter for letter, everything begins before it begins > but Marx wants to know the instant the ghost comes on stage—this is a manner of exorcism

SPOM.content: commodity is a born cynic, effaces differences, the cynic prostitutes itself, ready to exchange body and soul, original prostitution
SPOM.linkedContent: commodity is a born cynic, effaces differences, the cynic prostitutes itself, ready to exchange body and soul, original prostitution

SPOM.content: if commodity corrupts art [Derrida veering away from Marx], becoming-commodity attested to value it puts in danger > commodity put to work the principle of art
SPOM.linkedContent: if commodity corrupts art [Derrida veering away from Marx], becoming-commodity attested to value it puts in danger > commodity put to work the principle of art

POOF.content: what does ‘common’ mean once friendship goes beyond all living community? when it comes to friends only in dying? > common becomes valueless for thinking friendship
POOF.linkedContent: what does ‘common’ mean once friendship goes beyond all living community? when it comes to friends only in dying? > common becomes valueless for thinking friendship

POO.content: [2nd type of nonresponse] silence, protection, “insolent weapon and most deadly irony,” absolutely elliptical, shelters one, makes safe from objection, undermines responsibility, very essence of socius
POO.linkedContent: [2nd type of nonresponse] silence, protection, “insolent weapon and most deadly irony,” absolutely elliptical, shelters one, makes safe from objection, undermines responsibility, very essence of socius

POO.content: even if the secret makes social bonds possible it does not answer to them
POO.linkedContent: even if the secret makes social bonds possible it does not answer to them

HERP.content: [no friend w/out ear, no ear w/out friend] Dasein opening to voice of other as friend > absolutely originary [possibility of ethics?]
HERP.linkedContent: [no friend w/out ear, no ear w/out friend] Dasein opening to voice of other as friend > absolutely originary [possibility of ethics?]

HERP.content: an originary sharing (partage), an originary belonging
HERP.linkedContent: an originary sharing (partage), an originary belonging

HERP.content: shared belonging, in difference, inscribed, like an originary socius, through the ear, hearing the other-friend, the friend
HERP.linkedContent: shared belonging, in difference, inscribed, like an originary socius, through the ear, hearing the other-friend, the friend

HERP.content: acc. Heidegger, sophists, media, liberalism, commerce, the majority forget, don’t hear logos, philein, Sein, this forgetting leads to aggression (Zugriff) [see Freud’s Civilization and Its Discontents]
HERP.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, sophists, media, liberalism, commerce, the majority forget, don’t hear logos, philein, Sein, this forgetting leads to aggression (Zugriff) [see Freud’s Civilization and Its Discontents]

HERP.content: Verfall into optics, spectacle, noise > poets, thinkers not tolerated
HERP.linkedContent: Verfall into optics, spectacle, noise > poets, thinkers not tolerated

HASD.content: homology btwn secret group (topography of social link) and the place of the secret (beyond all position)
HASD.linkedContent: homology btwn secret group (topography of social link) and the place of the secret (beyond all position)

F.content: 1st paradigm of introjection: “fill the mouth’s void w/ words” [Abraham] > language substituted as a figure of presence w/in a community of empty mouths
F.linkedContent: 1st paradigm of introjection: “fill the mouth’s void w/ words” [Abraham] > language substituted as a figure of presence w/in a community of empty mouths

F.content: tombstone is “illicit,” marks extreme jouissance, attempt to break in [analyze] isn’t illegal, a market is organized around crypt, when introjection is thwarted > evaluates rates (taux) of pleasure (jouissance) & pain (forum or for, la place de marché, fur)
F.linkedContent: tombstone is “illicit,” marks extreme jouissance, attempt to break in [analyze] isn’t illegal, a market is organized around crypt, when introjection is thwarted > evaluates rates (taux) of pleasure (jouissance) & pain (forum or for, la place de marché, fur)

F.content: [how the program (market, rates) is inevitable but as a place to exhume]
F.linkedContent: [how the program (market, rates) is inevitable but as a place to exhume]

FWT.content: Derrida’s wares are more perverse, contraband, than his father’s (sees his father as exemplary figure of the victim, of “sacrifice,” voûté); perhaps Derrida is avenging his father by introducing disorder into “commerce,” whose trial he would be organizing
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida’s wares are more perverse, contraband, than his father’s (sees his father as exemplary figure of the victim, of “sacrifice,” voûté); perhaps Derrida is avenging his father by introducing disorder into “commerce,” whose trial he would be organizing

ATIA.content: for Kant [via Adorno], animals have no teleology (so always a means), they have no dignity (Würde), that is, no priceless internal value, so always a price, always belong to sensible world that must be sacrificed; Adorno sees in this a hatred towards animals, a Kant avec Sade
ATIA.linkedContent: for Kant [via Adorno], animals have no teleology (so always a means), they have no dignity (Würde), that is, no priceless internal value, so always a price, always belong to sensible world that must be sacrificed; Adorno sees in this a hatred towards animals, a Kant avec Sade

AFR.content: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)
AFR.linkedContent: Condillac’s theory of analogy (operation of remarking): supply a language’s defects > remarks anteriority in the fact, an anteriority (of the fact) that becomes lacking in itself > supply what is necessary, is missing (il faut), but [remark] also presents itself as surplus value, a superabundance, frivolous futility > makes all commerce possible (as value & sign)

AFR.content: for Condillac, arbitrariness of sign makes commerce freer and more extensive: commerce rescues man from relation to present object only > thus, the proper, property of sign, is system of the arbitrary; Condillac: “until commerce, natural signs are not at all properly signs”
AFR.linkedContent: for Condillac, arbitrariness of sign makes commerce freer and more extensive: commerce rescues man from relation to present object only > thus, the proper, property of sign, is system of the arbitrary; Condillac: “until commerce, natural signs are not at all properly signs”

AFR.content: frivolous extension (leaves idea w/out thing, sign w/out idea) increases w/ progress itself, follows teleological movement > extends to limit of what it disintegrates: commerce, language, institution
AFR.linkedContent: frivolous extension (leaves idea w/out thing, sign w/out idea) increases w/ progress itself, follows teleological movement > extends to limit of what it disintegrates: commerce, language, institution

IW.content: Kant, Jew, German: co-substantial reciprocity, their socius (alliance, spiritual symbiosis, psyche) is very socius that makes subjectum a moral being, a freedom, a person
IW.linkedContent: Kant, Jew, German: co-substantial reciprocity, their socius (alliance, spiritual symbiosis, psyche) is very socius that makes subjectum a moral being, a freedom, a person

IW.content: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national
IW.linkedContent: Fichte’s great “discovery”: ego cogito is national, Self is social, in essence a national Self, cogito not formal [Kant] but in relation to other, a history, a language, substantially national

IW.content: “I” signs first in its spiritual language

EL.content: the turn to everyday sacredness (secular Hebrew): miraculous manna but also profanatory jouissance > sorcerers: sinister masquerade, quasi Esperanto or Valapük, living dead in a shoddy resurrection used for commerce > evacuation & perversion of meaning
EL.linkedContent: the turn to everyday sacredness (secular Hebrew): miraculous manna but also profanatory jouissance > sorcerers: sinister masquerade, quasi Esperanto or Valapük, living dead in a shoddy resurrection used for commerce > evacuation & perversion of meaning

EL.content: the false cadaver will avenge itself its carnival disguises, its cadaverous instrumentality
EL.linkedContent: the false cadaver will avenge itself its carnival disguises, its cadaverous instrumentality

EL.content: iconoclasm & idolatry at same time (if that’s possible): turn infinite value into a commercial one (both use & exchange)
EL.linkedContent: iconoclasm & idolatry at same time (if that’s possible): turn infinite value into a commercial one (both use & exchange)

EL.content: w/in “logic” of fetishism, no one ones who’s doing the fetishizing: Scholem or those he accuses? (via Enlightenment tradition prepared by Spinoza, it would be Scholem)
EL.linkedContent: w/in “logic” of fetishism, no one ones who’s doing the fetishizing: Scholem or those he accuses? (via Enlightenment tradition prepared by Spinoza, it would be Scholem)

EL.content: prophesying about modern Israel, Scholem sees risk of commercializing the sacred [?]
EL.linkedContent: prophesying about modern Israel, Scholem sees risk of commercializing the sacred [?]

HST.content: Levinas: future (avenir) as a resurrection of the present; “next instant” is an annulment of commitment to existence made in the instant; the “I’s” death in the empty interval: condition of new birth
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: future (avenir) as a resurrection of the present; “next instant” is an annulment of commitment to existence made in the instant; the “I’s” death in the empty interval: condition of new birth

HST.content: at moment where everything is lost, everything is possible
HST.linkedContent: at moment where everything is lost, everything is possible

HST.content: Levinas: hope is a hope for the present itself, “its martyrdom doesn’t slip into the past, leaving us w/ a right to wages”
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: hope is a hope for the present itself, “its martyrdom doesn’t slip into the past, leaving us w/ a right to wages”

HST.content: circular commerce: force someone to forgive you, to invite you +	R p. 160 appeased commerce (regulated exchange of 2 elements)
HST.linkedContent: circular commerce: force someone to forgive you, to invite you + R p. 160 appeased commerce (regulated exchange of 2 elements)

HST.content: into (over) the bargain (the market) (par-dessus le marché), not au-dessus (above) the market (the lure in which you would again let yourself be caught) > puts in play, or en abyme, the destructive simulacra of surplus value
HST.linkedContent: into (over) the bargain (the market) (par-dessus le marché), not au-dessus (above) the market (the lure in which you would again let yourself be caught) > puts in play, or en abyme, the destructive simulacra of surplus value

C.content: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche
C.linkedContent: contingent can do w/out discourse, a masterpiece can’t do w/out a cartouche (on the market & in itself: if you insist on this distinction) > even when the cartouche remains, is defunct: pas de cartouche, plus de cartouche > what will have been able to do w/out it? never touched, aussi impassible et invulnérable qu’aux harcèlements du trait: c’est peut-être qu’il était déjà dans la tombe, le cartouche

OG.content: society as a furnace, man rummages the entrails (fouille les entrailles) of the earth, blindness to plants, nature, mother, moving from blindness to the supplement is the law, we can’t make supplement emerge from its shadow > we speak its reserve (nous en disons la réserve)
OG.linkedContent: society as a furnace, man rummages the entrails (fouille les entrailles) of the earth, blindness to plants, nature, mother, moving from blindness to the supplement is the law, we can’t make supplement emerge from its shadow > we speak its reserve (nous en disons la réserve)

OG.content: imposition of form via spacing, beyond classical model of causality, a new transcendental aesthetic guided by inscription: writing, as Rousseau intuited, linked to nature of social space > inscription as habitation in general
OG.linkedContent: imposition of form via spacing, beyond classical model of causality, a new transcendental aesthetic guided by inscription: writing, as Rousseau intuited, linked to nature of social space > inscription as habitation in general

CIR.content: pri, prendre, pris, prier, Proust; anger/irony at Proust’s Franco-Brittanic decorum (Joyce, Heidegger, Wittgenstein): work in which there are theories leaves its price tag > grimace of a good taste naive enough to think it can efface labor of theory: I write w/ price on display
CIR.linkedContent: pri, prendre, pris, prier, Proust; anger/irony at Proust’s Franco-Brittanic decorum (Joyce, Heidegger, Wittgenstein): work in which there are theories leaves its price tag > grimace of a good taste naive enough to think it can efface labor of theory: I write w/ price on display

CIR.content: “I am for an aristocracy w/out distinction, therefore w/out vulgarity, for a democracy of the compulsion to the highest price, you have to pay the price to read the price displayed”
CIR.linkedContent: “I am for an aristocracy w/out distinction, therefore w/out vulgarity, for a democracy of the compulsion to the highest price, you have to pay the price to read the price displayed”

SPEC.content: reality principle as courier, lieutenant, of PP, disciplining disciple, defers enjoyment, the waystation (relais) of a differance (Aufschub), auf dem langen Umwege zur Lust, as if RP produces a socius, institution, contract of discipline
SPEC.linkedContent: reality principle as courier, lieutenant, of PP, disciplining disciple, defers enjoyment, the waystation (relais) of a differance (Aufschub), auf dem langen Umwege zur Lust, as if RP produces a socius, institution, contract of discipline

SPEC.content: fort/da: argument of spool, not a story, not a myth > to give it a title is to accredit the deposit, the investiture
SPEC.linkedContent: fort/da: argument of spool, not a story, not a myth > to give it a title is to accredit the deposit, the investiture

SPEC.content: payer la science de son proper nom, science of his [Freud’s] proper name (propre nom) inseparable from nom propre: speculation, pay in advance the charges for a return to sender: reste à s’avoir (it remains to be had/seen/known)
SPEC.linkedContent: payer la science de son proper nom, science of his [Freud’s] proper name (propre nom) inseparable from nom propre: speculation, pay in advance the charges for a return to sender: reste à s’avoir (it remains to be had/seen/known)

SPEC.content: State, multicellular society, socius, guarding life beyond death of any given subject, serves to reproduce & rejuvenate other cells
SPEC.linkedContent: State, multicellular society, socius, guarding life beyond death of any given subject, serves to reproduce & rejuvenate other cells

WBH.content: if gift has assignable destination, is an exchange, it’s not a gift, if there is from man to woman (or woman to man) an assignable destination (re: object, discourse, jouissance, desire, subject), no longer a gift > gift must be absolutely unconscious & random to be given a chance
WBH.linkedContent: if gift has assignable destination, is an exchange, it’s not a gift, if there is from man to woman (or woman to man) an assignable destination (re: object, discourse, jouissance, desire, subject), no longer a gift > gift must be absolutely unconscious & random to be given a chance
